bitfield.description: 0 = disconnected. 1-15 = connected to channelID = CHANID.

bitenum.description: 0 is an allowed value, signifying that the event is unconnected
A value of 0 specifies that the event is not connected
Consult your device datasheet as the actual allowed maximum may be less than 15.

bitfield.description: Enable the power
Clear the RESETSTKY bit in the STAT register
Assert reset to the peripheral
Async Clock Request is blocked from starting SYSOSC or forcing bus clock to 32MHz
This bit indicates, if the peripheral was reset, since this bit was cleared by RESETSTKYCLR in the RSTCTL register

bitenum.description: The peripheral has not been reset since this bit was last cleared by RESETSTKYCLR in the RSTCTL register
The peripheral was reset since the last bit clear

register.description: Clock Select for Ultra Low Power peripherals

bitfield.description: Selects LFCLK as clock source if enabled

bitenum.description: LFCLK is disabled as clock source
LFCLK is enabled as clock source

bitfield.description: Interrupt index status
Enable Alarm-2 interrupt
Enable Prescaler-0 interrupt
Enable Prescaler-1 interrupt

Enable RTC-Ready interrupt
Enable Alarm-1 interrupt

Event line mode 0 select

bitenum.description: The interrupt or event line is disabled.
The interrupt or event line is in software mode. The software ISR clears the associated RIS flag.
The interrupt or event line is in hardware mode. The hardware (another module) clears automatically the associated RIS flag.

bitfield.description: Event line mode 1 select

bitenum.description: The interrupt or event line is disabled.
The interrupt or event line is in software mode. The software ISR clears the associated RIS flag.
The interrupt or event line is in hardware mode. The hardware (another module) clears automatically the associated RIS flag.

bitfield.description: Minor revision. This number holds the module revision and is incremented by the module developers. n = Minor module revision (see device-specific data sheet)
Major revision. This number holds the module revision and is incremented by the module developers. n = Major version (see device-specific data sheet)
Instantiated version. Describes which instance of the module accessed.

bitenum.description: This is the default, if there is only one instance - like for SSIM

bitfield.description: Feature set of this module. Differentiates the complexity of the actually instantiated module if there are differences.
Module identifier. This ID is unique for each module. 0x0911 = Module ID of the RTC Module
This bit enables the supply of the 32kHz clock to the RTC. It will not power-up the 32kHz crystal oscillator this needs to be done in the Clock System Module.

bitenum.description: 32kHz clock is not supplied to the RTC.
32kHz clock is supplied to the RTC.

bitfield.description: Debug Run.

bitenum.description: Counter is halted if CPU is in debug state.
Continue to operate normally ignoring the debug state of the CPU.

bitfield.description: Debug Interrupt Enable.

bitenum.description: Interrupts of the module will not be captured anymore if CPU is in debug state. Which means no update to the RTCRIS, RTCMISC and RTCIIDX register.
Interrupts are enabled in debug mode. Interrupt requests are signaled to the interrupt controller. If the flags are required by software (polling mode) the DGBINT bit need to be set to 1.

bitfield.description: Real-time clock time event.
Real-time clock BCD select. Selects BCD counting for real-time clock.
Real-time clock ready. This bit indicates when the real-time clock time values are safe for reading.

bitenum.description: RTC time values safe for reading

bitfield.description: Real-time clock temperature compensation ready. This is a read only bit that indicates when the RTCTCMPx can be written. Write to RTCTCMPx should be avoided when RTCTCRDY is reset.

bitenum.description: Real-time clock temperature compensation not ready

bitfield.description: Real-time clock temperature compensation write OK. This is a read-only bit that indicates if the write to RTCTCMP is successful or not.

Real-time clock offset error calibration. Each LSB represents approximately +1ppm (RTCOCALXS = 1) or -1ppm (RTCOCALXS = 0) adjustment in frequency. Maximum effective calibration value is +/-240ppm. Excess values written above +/-240ppm will be ignored by hardware.

bitenum.description: Maximum effective calibration value is +/-240ppm. Excess values written above +/-240ppm will be ignored by hardware.

bitfield.description: Real-time clock offset error calibration sign. This bit decides the sign of offset error calibration.
Real-time clock calibration frequency. Selects frequency output to RTC_OUT pin for calibration measurement. The corresponding port must be configured for the peripheral module function.

bitenum.description: No frequency output to RTC_OUT pin

bitfield.description: Real-time clock temperature compensation. Value written into this register is used for temperature compensation of RTC. Each LSB represents approximately +1ppm (RTCTCMPS = 1) or -1ppm (RTCTCMPS = 0) adjustment in frequency. Maximum effective calibration value is +/-240ppm. Excess values written above +/-240ppm are ignored by hardware. Reading from RTCTCMP register at any time returns the cumulative value which is the signed addition of RTCOCALx and RTCTCMPX values, and the updated sign bit (RTCTCMPS) of the addition result.
Real-time clock temperature compensation sign. This bit decides the sign of temperature compensation.

register.description: RTC Seconds Register - Calendar Mode With Binary / BCD Format

bitfield.description: Seconds Binary (0 to 59). If RTCBCD=1 write to these bits will be ignored and read give the value 0.
Seconds BCD low digit (0 to 9). If RTCBCD=0 write to these bits will be ignored and read give the value 0.
Seconds BCD high digit (0 to 5). If RTCBCD=0 write to these bits will be ignored and read give the value 0.

register.description: RTC Minutes Register - Calendar Mode With Binary / BCD Format

bitfield.description: Minutes Binary (0 to 59). If RTCBCD=1 write to these bits will be ignored and read give the value 0.
Minutes BCD low digit (0 to 9). If RTCBCD=0 write to these bits will be ignored and read give the value 0.
Minutes BCD high digit (0 to 5). If RTCBCD=0 write to these bits will be ignored and read give the value 0.

register.description: RTC Hours Register - Calendar Mode With Binary / BCD Format

bitfield.description: Hours Binary (0 to 23). If RTCBCD=1 write to these bits will be ignored and read give the value 0.
Hours BCD low digit (0 to 9). If RTCBCD=0 write to these bits will be ignored and read give the value 0.
Hours BCD high digit (0 to 2). If RTCBCD=0 write to these bits will be ignored and read give the value 0.

register.description: RTC Day Of Week / Month Register - Calendar Mode With Binary / BCD Format

bitfield.description: Day of week (0 to 6). These bits are valid if RTCBCD=1 or RTCBCD=0.
Day of month Binary (1 to 28, 29, 30, 31). If RTCBCD=1 write to these bits will be ignored and read give the value 0.
Day of month BCD low digit (0 to 9). If RTCBCD=0 write to these bits will be ignored and read give the value 0.
Day of month BCD high digit (0 to 3). If RTCBCD=0 write to these bits will be ignored and read give the value 0.

register.description: RTC Month Register - Calendar Mode With Binary / BCD Format

bitfield.description: Month Binary (1 to 12). If RTCBCD=1 write to these bits will be ignored and read give the value 0.
Month BCD low digit (0 to 9). If RTCBCD=0 write to these bits will be ignored and read give the value 0.
Month BCD high digit (0 or 1). If RTCBCD=0 write to these bits will be ignored and read give the value 0.

register.description: RTC Year Register - Calendar Mode With Binary / BCD Format

bitfield.description: Year Binary low byte. Valid values for Year are 0 to 4095. If RTCBCD=1 write to these bits will be ignored and read give the value 0.
Year Binary high byte. Valid values for Year are 0 to 4095. If RTCBCD=1 write to these bits will be ignored and read give the value 0.
Year BCD lowest digit (0 to 9). If RTCBCD=0 write to these bits will be ignored and read give the value 0.
Decade BCD (0 to 9). If RTCBCD=0 write to these bits will be ignored and read give the value 0.
Century BCD low digit (0 to 9). If RTCBCD=0 write to these bits will be ignored and read give the value 0.
Century BCD high digit (0 to 4). If RTCBCD=0 write to these bits will be ignored and read give the value 0.

register.description: RTC Minute Alarm Register - Calendar Mode With Binary / BCD Format

bitfield.description: Alarm Minutes Binary (0 to 59). If RTCBCD=1 write to these bits will be ignored and read give the value 0.
Alarm Minutes Binary enable. If RTCBCD=1 this bit is always 0. Write to this bit will be ignored.
Alarm Minutes BCD low digit (0 to 9). If RTCBCD=0 write to these bits will be ignored and read give the value 0.
Alarm Minutes BCD high digit (0 to 5). If RTCBCD=0 write to these bits will be ignored and read give the value 0.
Alarm Minutes BCD enable. If RTCBCD=0 this bit is always 0. Write to this bit will be ignored.

register.description: RTC Hours Alarm Register - Calendar Mode With Binary / BCD Format

bitfield.description: Alarm Hours Binary (0 to 23). If RTCBCD=1 write to these bits will be ignored and read give the value 0.
Alarm Hours Binary enable. If RTCBCD=1 this bit is always 0. Write to this bit will be ignored.
Alarm Hours BCD low digit (0 to 9). If RTCBCD=0 write to these bits will be ignored and read give the value 0.
Alarm Hours BCD high digit (0 to 2). If RTCBCD=0 write to these bits will be ignored and read give the value 0..
Alarm Hours BCD enable. If RTCBCD=0 this bit is always 0. Write to this bit will be ignored.

register.description: RTC Alarm Day Of Week / Month Register - Calendar Mode With Binary / BCD Format

bitfield.description: Alarm Day of week (0 to 6). These bits are valid if RTCBCD=1 or RTCBCD=0.
Alarm Day of week enable. This bit are valid if RTCBCD=1 or RTCBCD=0.
Alarm Day of month Binary (1 to 28, 29, 30, 31) If RTCBCD=1 write to these bits will be ignored and read give the value 0.
Alarm Day of month Binary enable. If RTCBCD=1 this bit is always 0. Write to this bit will be ignored.
Alarm Day of month BCD low digit (0 to 9). If RTCBCD=0 write to these bits will be ignored and read give the value 0.
Alarm Day of month BCD high digit (0 to 3). If RTCBCD=0 write to these bits will be ignored and read give the value 0.
Alarm Day of month BCD enable. If RTCBCD=0 this bit is always 0. Write to this bit will be ignored.

register.description: RTC Minute Alarm Register - Calendar Mode With Binary / BCD Format

bitfield.description: Alarm Minutes Binary (0 to 59). If RTCBCD=1 write to these bits will be ignored and read give the value 0.
Alarm Minutes Binary enable. If RTCBCD=1 this bit is always 0. Write to this bit will be ignored.
Alarm Minutes BCD low digit (0 to 9). If RTCBCD=0 write to these bits will be ignored and read give the value 0.
Alarm Minutes BCD high digit (0 to 5). If RTCBCD=0 write to these bits will be ignored and read give the value 0.
Alarm Minutes BCD enable. If RTCBCD=0 this bit is always 0. Write to this bit will be ignored.

register.description: RTC Hours Alarm Register - Calendar Mode With Binary / BCD Format

bitfield.description: Alarm Hours Binary (0 to 23). If RTCBCD=1 write to these bits will be ignored and read give the value 0.
Alarm Hours Binary enable. If RTCBCD=1 this bit is always 0. Write to this bit will be ignored.
Alarm Hours BCD low digit (0 to 9). If RTCBCD=0 write to these bits will be ignored and read give the value 0.
Alarm Hours BCD high digit (0 to 2). If RTCBCD=0 write to these bits will be ignored and read give the value 0..
Alarm Hours BCD enable. If RTCBCD=0 this bit is always 0. Write to this bit will be ignored.

register.description: RTC Alarm Day Of Week / Month Register - Calendar Mode With Binary / BCD Format

bitfield.description: Alarm Day of week (0 to 6). These bits are valid if RTCBCD=1 or RTCBCD=0.
Alarm Day of week enable. This bit are valid if RTCBCD=1 or RTCBCD=0.
Alarm Day of month Binary (1 to 28, 29, 30, 31) If RTCBCD=1 write to these bits will be ignored and read give the value 0.
Alarm Day of month Binary enable. If RTCBCD=1 this bit is always 0. Write to this bit will be ignored.
Alarm Day of month BCD low digit (0 to 9). If RTCBCD=0 write to these bits will be ignored and read give the value 0.
Alarm Day of month BCD high digit (0 to 3). If RTCBCD=0 write to these bits will be ignored and read give the value 0.
Alarm Day of month BCD enable. If RTCBCD=0 this bit is always 0. Write to this bit will be ignored.
Prescale timer 0 interrupt interval
Prescale timer 1 interrupt interval
